author: David Maddock
title: Liverpool set to use Philippe Coutinho to plug their Sadio Mane-shape hole up front against Manchester United
text:
Klopp faces the press after Liverpool lose to Southampton Share this video Watch Next 
His manager is reluctant to throw the Brazil star back into a game as intense as a visit to Manchester United , but he accepts he has little option. 
Klopp knows Mane’s ability to beat a man and attack at speed are vital to Liverpool’s style of play. And while Coutinho is not exactly the same type of player, he possesses a similar ability to drive into the box and commit defenders, which is what was lacking against Saints. 
The German coach conceded as much when he suggested that he has options in reproducing the vital role that Mane performs, with Coutinho providing the most obvious one. Liverpool had been without Coutinho since Sunderland's visit in late November (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Read More ANDY DUNN: Charisma can take you so far, Jurgen, but cash takes you to the top 
“It is a nice question,” he said of how he will cope with life without Mane, “But, yes, we have a plan. 
“We have a specific solution and then we will think about the next game. We will try to figure out which one works best. 
"There is no player exactly like Sadio. But it is not a problem, we will find solutions. Kop boss Klopp may be without Mane's attacking edge for another month (Photo: Getty) Read More A Liverpool win at Man United would show how far the pendulum has swung in that rivalry 
“We know there is a difference between fit and match-fit, but of course it’s Phil, we have another three days to prepare him for United. 
"It was the best news [of the night] at ­Southampton, that Phil is back. You can see immediately how ­important it is. He will of course not be 100 per cent, but he can be ­important for us, and it is good he is back.” poll loading What's your prediction for this one? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
